creator: apache@shannonbrown.net
text:
The Apache Log indicates the following.
[emerg] (2)No such file or directory: Error while opening the workers

Tomcat Version 3.2.3

Tomcat 3.2.1 worked fine.  Apache will not launch at all due to this error.

Tomcat configured properly.
All environment variables set properly.
Apache works if mod_jk.conf-auto commented out

creator: nacho@apache.org
text: Need More info .. Work for most users..

creator: apache@shannonbrown.net
text:
Apache fails to start.  According to the Apache log, the failure is due to the 
failure to identify the workers file or directory.  Version 3.2.1 of Tomcat did 
not exhibit this problem.  The workers file used with 3.2.3 is the default 
workers file in the default location.  JAVA_HOME and TOMCAT_HOME are both set 
correctly and are verified via echo-ing the variables.  The problem appears to 
exist with setting up the mod_jk connection in 3.2.3.  All permissions are set 
at the defaults.  The mod_jk version used is the downloadable version -- the 
mod_jk module was NOT custom built.

Installing Tomcat 4.07b worked fine on the same system.

creator: hgomez@slib.fr
text:
Thanks to add more information like Operating system, httpd.conf,
mod_jk.conf, and workers.properties.

Normally you should have at minima in httpd.conf :

JkWorkersFile /mypath/to/myconf/workers.properties
JkLogFile /mypath/to/mylog/mod_jk.log
JkLogLevel error

Nota the FULL PATH, don't use relative (ie: ../..)
